pros:
Many international exchange activities for members
Lots of training
cons: The workload is heavy, miscommunication between members and leaders

pros:
- Amazing people, great teamwork experience with respect, appreciation and support for one another. Meet people who you can learn a lot from
- Work in a corporate-like model: can learn from the system
- Have great visions (Strive to achieve peace and fulfillment of humankind's potentials) and value sets (Leadership qualities, AIESEC values, etc.) to learn from
- Lively, fun, might be suitable for those wanting a youthful college experience
- Make international friends
cons:
- Need to run errands
- Not a fully professional environment
- Few measurable impacts on solving world issues, but has impacts on human development

job_title: Vice President Finance in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: The diverse team with 6 nationalities working in one year. Everyone was very straight-forward and all striven for the common results. Working time was very flexible. Strongly recommend for senior students and fresh graduate to get the first global working experience.
cons: The team was all new at the beginning. Certain growth map & mentor was not supported in time for team members to perform.

review_title: National Vice-President of Marketing for AIESEC in Vietnam
job_title: Vice President of Marketing in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
- Awesome working culture
- Working with a team of youth but stakeholders can be the celebrities of the business world
- Freedom to fail, learn and endless opportunities of growth
- Make friends for life
cons:
- Difficult work-life balance
- People get trapped inside the AIESEC bubble and fail to realize that there is a huge world outside too

review_title: Making social impact while pursuing personal development
pros:
- Very people oriented: leaders are passionate about each member's personal development
- A lot to learn if you are new to the business world
- Global experiences
cons:
Most of the members are youths who lack hands-on experiences,
If you work for a local chapter, there's no salaries whatsoever.

review_title: International platform for young people to explore and develop their leadership potential
pros:
INternational environment
Various positions differing in job descriptions to try
cons: it values professional but still embrace what represents a student-organization

job_title: Team Leader in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
A good place to learn about leadership, get training from alumnae or big companies: Nielson, Unilever, ...
Always care for people
cons: Low financial supports, lack of professionalism in Local Committee – local section

job_title: Manager in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
Best organization to learn about leadership and how to develop people.
Great environment.
cons: Lots of work. Somtimes you may have difficulties in balancing work-life stuff.

job_title: Branch Manager of Business Development in Hanoi
pros:
Leadership quality
Networking with talented and elite students
Opportunity to work with high-profile partners
International Exchange Program
cons:
Lot of Overtime
Midnight meeting due to the different time zone

job_title: Volunteer in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: Wonderful experience. Got to meet and get to know  people  all around the world.
cons: No cons, I would recommend this experience for everyone.
